Package net.joala.bdd.reference

References are used to carry information between steps.

See:
          Description

Interface Summary
Reference<T> A reference is meant to be used to be shared among steps of BDD tests written in JUnit.
SelfDescribingReference<T> Self describable references may be printed to log along with the steps where they are used.
 

Class Summary
ReferenceImpl<T> Implementation of Reference.
References Factory methods for creating references.
SelfDescribingReferenceImpl<T> Default implementation of SelfDescribingReference.
 

Exception Summary
PropertyAlreadySetException Denotes that you try to reset a property of a reference.
PropertyNotSetException Denotes that a property of a reference you try to read is not set.
ReferenceAlreadyBoundException Denotes that a Reference already has a value.
ReferenceNotBoundException Denotes that you try to read a reference which is not yet bound to a value.
 

Package net.joala.bdd.reference Description

References are used to carry information between steps. References can be written once and read multiple times. As additional features references might be enriched with properties to describe the contained object in more detail for later assertions.

Since:
9/27/12
